fields.description:
This is to be calculated using -an average time spent per completed story point (or any other estimation statistic)- average story points per day in a given release so far, plus optimistic and pessimistic variants by adding or subtracting -one standard deviation- 10% from it. (note this was changed because we already return data for story points completed by date but not time per story, and a standard deviation was too big of a difference in most cases and didn't seem to make sense)

# The projections must be displayed somewhere outside of the chart as well.
# Released versions do not need to show projections.
# Show the intended release date on the chart (midnight end of the date specified).
# Do not show calculations of velocity in the page.
# Take NWD into account with the calculation of mean and SD.
# Tooltips for potential targets show "type" (optimistic, pessimistic) and date.
# At least 10% of total estimated work for the Version must be completed before projections are shown.

(!) Development Notes (!)
Q: What if users are using negative story points?
A: If the predicted release date is in the past, we shouldn't display a prediction at all.

Q: What if any of the rates approach infinity?
A: We probably need to discuss with [~jrogers] [~mjopson] [~tkotecki] what is a good point to cut off. At the moment, if the predicted date is infinity, we don't display a prediction. If the most pessimistic date is infinity, we display a flat line and cut the chart off after the predicted date. But as long as it's not infinity, we display it. 

Q: What distinguishes a rate that approaches vertical from the scope change events that ARE vertical?
A: (x) Not Answered (Don't really understand this question)

Q: What happens when users change the estimation of their board, or remove it completely?
A: The board will reflect the current estimation. 

Q: What if the estimation uses time tracking? Will we calculate deviation in minutes, hours, days? How will this be reflected on the axis?
A: We will calculate units (of estimation) completed per day and use this to project. The axis won't change from what is displayed now: X is time and Y is estimation units.

Q: What if the user is tracking work with Logged Work? Should this rate also be displayed?
A: (x) Not Answered (do you mean time tracking?)

Q: What do we display if a projected line goes significantly into the future before it touches the scope line? Potentially this could be years into the future, but this isn't realistic to display.
A: The chart expands to display the most pessimistic date, unless it's infinity, in which case it expands to show the middle prediction. It could be years. 

Q: What happens to the lines if the version has been released?
A: If the version is marked as released or if total scope = total completed scope then we shouldn't display a prediction. 

Q: What happens to the lines if the "predicted" release date is moved to the past?
A: This should never happen.

Q: What happens if the release date is moved into the future?
A: Marking a version as released is separate from displaying a release date. Regardless of whether a release date is assigned, we will try to predict a date if total scope > completed scope and the version is not marked as released in JIRA.

Q: What if the release date is removed?
A: See above.

Q: What happens to the projected lines if issues are removed from the version (resulting in scope change) or deleted entirely (resulting in chart change without history)?
A: The scope line stays horizontal so if scope is removed then it moves down and in theory the release date should move forward. If the story was completed before it was removed then it's used in the calculation of average points completed per day.
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to be able to see a projection of possible end date of a version

fields.description:
This is about plugging into the plugin point exposed by JIRA and

- specify the title
- hijack the project post creation and redirect to GH
- separate buttons for Scrum + Kanban
- Simplified workflow by default without option to select

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Is there differing implementation between btf and OD that we need to consider? Application permissions?
A: (/) I don't believe there should be any, these would relate to installation of GH when it's not present and will be dealt with in subsequent stories

Q: What board configuration do we allow from this dialog?
A: (/) This story only covers the minimum - the user will be able to specify project name, key and project lead (all of that provided by JIRA already), and we need to create a board for that project, assuming simplified workflow

Q: What happens to our old create project+board dialog?
A: (/) Nothing

fields.description:
Today, a Scrum Master planning a sprint doesn't have a way of committing to completing sub-tasks from stories that they don't intend to close.  They either have to work on the sub-tasks from stories not in the current sprint and have the hour burndown appear to be ahead of the guideline, or they have to pull the stories and all of their tasks into the sprint in which case the hour burndown appears to be behind the guideline.

This was functionality that the classic boards supported (perhaps inadvertently), but it allowed the team to commit to a set of stories to complete and the tasks they could complete on stories that they know at the outset won't be closed.

I will leave the design of a solution to this to the GH team since you've purposefully left sub-types off the planning board.  I will propose a straw man to get this started though:
* Add a special "drop zone" at the bottom of the sprint that a story could be dragged to and which would trigger a dialog that would allow the user to select which tasks to include in that sprint. 
* Ideally the story would then appear in that sprint but with a visual designation (dimmed?) to indicate that the entire story wasn't committed.  
* A story would still only be committed to a single sprint but could conceivably have tasks included in 'n' other sprints.
* Zero story points from the story should be allocated to the sprints where a story has tasks included but where the story itself has not been committed.
* The hour total for the planning view should be updated to include the tasks from the story that were selected for inclusion.
* A task can only be in a single sprint
* In work view, users should only see the tasks planned for that sprint and the story swimlane should have a similar visual indicator to what's seen on the planning board (dimmed?) to show that it won't be completed in the current sprint
* The hour burndown report for the sprints should include only the tasks that were selected for inclusion in the sprint
* The sprint report should show an additional class of stories which are denoted as having had work done, but which weren't part of the commit.
* Issue search by sprint should show the stories and tasks that were committed to a sprint.  A story that had 3/10 tasks allocated to sprint 1, should not itself appear in a search for issues included in sprint 1.  But the three tasks included in sprint 1 should appear in the search results.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I want to commit my team to starting work on stories in my next sprint that won't be completed until the following sprint without including the full story in the team's commitment

fields.description:
Currently issues will drop into a future sprint if one exists or to the backlog otherwise. This is inconsistent and causes confusion.
Update so that when closing a sprint with incomplete items the behaviour is predictable and enables better planning/organisation.

If no future sprints exist (in the board where the sprint is closed) move incomplete items to the backlog (placed according to rank)

If future sprints exist (in the board where the sprint is closed) give the options to move all items to:
* Named future sprint (pick one)
* Backlog (placed according to rank)

Consideration needed for incomplete work items in scenarios where not visible on the current board.
fields.summary: Ability to select destination for incomplete issues when closing a sprint

fields.description:
In a scrum board, a quick filter that applies a subtraction condition to the filter that is set to the board does not work if this filter is using a field of type _label_.

No quickfilter selected
!Board1.png!

"NOT test label" quick filter selected
!Board2.png!

Board Filter: 
{code}
project = Bug OR labels = test ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

Quick Filter:
{code}
labels != test
{code}

When you click on that quickfilter all issues disappear from the board. You would expect everything but tickets with label=test to remain on the board.  

This behaviour seems to be inherited from JIRA JQL itself, as shown below:

When looking for issues where project = Bug you have 6 results (condition A)
!JQL1.png!

When looking for issues where labels = test you have 3 results (condition B)
!JQL2.png!

When looking for A OR B you have 9 results 
!JQL3.png!

When simulating a quickfilter to subtract issues "A" ((A OR B) - A), you'll have B as result - Everything good so far
!JQL4.png!

Now, when simulating a quickfilter to subtract issues "B" ((A OR B) - B), you'll have nothing where you'd expect 6 issues as a result
!JQL5.png!
fields.summary: Quick filter does not work as expected

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Create a new project
- Create one workflow for the regular issue types and another workflow for the sub-tasks issue type. Associate these workflows to a workflow scheme, and the workflow scheme to the newly created project
- Create one issue and several sub-tasks to it
- Create the following filter:

{noformat}
parent = TST-1 ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}

- Now, create a Kanban board
- Change the filter associated to the board to the one created before
- Now, try to drag the unmapped statuses from the workflow associated to the sub-tasks to the columns. Once you drag the first status, all the other disappear. The status that was just mapped will be displayed with a (!) next to it. when putting the cursor on it, the following message will be displayed: "This status is not available in any of the workflows used by this board. To remove, drag it to unmapped statuses where it will no longer be available."
fields.summary: Kanban board filter that only retrieves sub-tasks doesn't work when sub-tasks use a different workflow than the parent issue

fields.description: After having done a full release plan with multiple sprints it is not possible to change the order of the sprints in Plan mode. This makes it difficult to create sprints ahead and then change the orders around based on priority changes in the backlog. Sometimes priority changes would result in not just moving individual stories between sprints but changing the sprints around completely. This is currently not possible. Also if you have created several sprints and needs to add sprints in the middle due to time consumption higher than expected you can not do that either.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper User, I would like to re-arrange sprints in the Planning mode

fields.description:
{{As an admin I'd like to set the default value for the Estimation field on new Greenhopper boards}}

As an admin I'd like to be able to set 'Original Estimate' (for example) as the default value for the Estimation to be used on every board created.

Currently the Estimation always use 'Story points' and we need to change the Estimation manually for each board created.

It would save a lot of time if that could be set as a default value on Greenhopper configuration so newly created boards are already with the desired value.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default Estimation field on new Agile boards

fields.description:
The prioritization of sub-task in Issue view page would not reflect the ranking of sub-task in GreenHopper as it uses the ranking instead. Thus, it would be great if ranking the sub-tasks within the parent issue/story is possible in the Plan mode. The work would be less efficient if the sub-tasks are able to be ranked in Work mode. 

Lets assume that there are 10 stories inside the sprint and each of the stories has 10 sub-tasks to be ranked. It isn't an efficient way to work where you would require to plan twice: once in during the Plan mode for the stories, and another during the work mode for the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: As a rapid board user, able to rank sub-task in Plan mode

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to edit or control the notifications sent by GreenHopper. Sometimes, some users would not want to receive notifications over minor changes (for example, Epic Name, or Epic color).

It would be useful if the user could somehow control these notifications, for example, in the Notification Scheme.
fields.summary: Allow control over JIRA Agile notifications

fields.description: currently custom field fetching writes quite a lot of lines of logging. overwrite to only log info for these services

fields.summary: Fix log4j.properties to not reference multi tenancy logger

fields.description:
The rapid board adds some super nice planning features, and we love the ability to edit issues directly in the 'Work' component of the rapid board. But the tasks and stories are rather disorganized.

The task board presented a beautiful layout and hierarchy of parent to child. It was easy to visualize the entire sprint, each story was logically partitioned from another. Sure, the page is sometimes long, but people have multiple size views to choose from if that's a concern.

The rapid board (5.9.4) doesn't give nearly as crisp and clear a view of the sprint. Tasks are hardly distinguishable from stories, there really isn't much to distinguish between parent (story) and child (task). And most importantly, there's no clean way of partitioning between stories (i.e. like the Task board creates horizontal swim lanes per story).

The Task Board creates a *full picture* of the entire sprint. The Rapid Board is feeling a bit more jumbled together, less crisp, it doesn't paint a picture of the sprint as well.

A concrete example to express the point: when a task is "In Progress" it only shows the parent ID "TT-1" for example. But nobody knows stories by their ID. 

For example: if I have two tasks with similar names assigned to two different stories, as in the example below:

Story: As a user I want a new page X
   -> Task: Cut PSD into Images [12hrs]

Story: As a user I want a new page Y
   -> Task: Cut PSD into Images [12hrs]

We're in trouble! It will be devilishly hard to distinguish between these tasks in the Rapid Board, but in the task board, due to its good organization, this is a non-issue. 

This is a real example from our current sprint. And it occurs many times over with simple task names such as "test some feature". With the rapid board, as is, we'll have to be much more vigilant about including identifying information in the task descriptions.

A minimalist solution would at least be to include the parent "description" in the "In Progress" list rather than just ID. But I think I'm going to miss my horizontal swim lanes per story as we have in the Task Board. 

Your task board is good, don't abandon it in full.
fields.summary: Rapid board lacks clear separation of sprint stories as the Task Board has

fields.description: For example, sort left column by priority and right column by update date
fields.summary: Allow sorting columns independently in the taskboard

fields.description: Like the ability to change the Rank numbers for the Rank field. The system automatically assigns a number which is large example 2040. It would be nice when you start a new sprint you were given the ability to start a new Ranking order just for that Sprint. For example start with "1" or "10", etc. Is there a way to accomplish this?
fields.summary: Ability to change Ranking numbers for the Rank Feild

fields.description: Would like to display the Rank Field in the Card and List Views. When you drag & drop the cards it would be nice to see each card Ranking number. You can view this in the Issue Navigator, but needs to be shown in GreenHopper. Otherwise there is no visual clue.
fields.summary: Ability to add the Rank Filed in Card and List Views.

fields.description:
Users should have the ability to insert dividers (horizontal lines) into their Agile Board backlogs under Plan view.

For example:
{noformat}story-1
story-2
------division-1--------
story-3
story-4
------division-2--------
story-5
story-6{noformat}
----
The rapid board sprint market is just the coolest thing since sliced bread, really!

So why not release markers? The easiest way to manage which issue is in a release and which not is to have a market that indicates where the release takes place. And we could easily count points in the release.

This is exactly how we organize the backlog in Excel (we've yet been convinced of moving the backlog to greenhopper, but are hoping to do so with the new Rapid board improvements).

Why would we use a planning board for releases and the rapid board planning for sprints? The rapid board is totally capable of taking over this functionality.
fields.summary: Rapid board planning - Ability to Add Dividers into Backlog

fields.description:
GH Classic has a version synchronizer that ensures that fixversion hierarchies are properly up to date for issues edited in JIRA.

Rapid board won't support hierarchies, and as a result dnd an issue to a new version will remove the hierarchy, which then would be readded by the synchronizer.

Add some way of warning the user that the synchronizer is active (if it is), to ensure they disable it when starting to use versions on the rapid board

More general: think about how we want to deal with the Version Synchronizer once we introduce version on the RB
fields.summary: As a user I want to be warned when the version synchronizer is enabled

fields.description:
When I'm using the Plan Mode and I assign issues to Epics, I am able to see the "Epic" label in the JIRA ticket. However, if I actually open up the ticket and view it in JIRA, I cannot see the Epic label.
I would like to be able to assign an issue to an Epic using the JIRA edit screen.
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to set the Epic link through JIRA

fields.description: Currently it is only possible to expand/collapse sprints that are already started. It would be great to do that to upcoming sprints and backlog as well.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to expand/collapse any sprint or the backlog in the Plan View

fields.description: It would be useful to always have the "Issues Link" section with the "Add Link" button for a story in the details pane of the Plan/Work views, even if there aren't any linked issues yet.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to see the "Issue Link" session with the "Add Link" button on the issue detailed view even if there aren't any linked issues yet

fields.description: It would be useful to keep the menu bar with filters as well as the column headings static when scrolling on the plan/work board.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to keep the menu bar (quick filters) as well as the column headings static when scrolling on plan/work mode

fields.description:
In the old classic boards there used to be a shortcut option (by pressing 'w') to update the priority of the issues. Now with the new rapid boards, the option is not there anymore. We need to go through the following steps : 
# select the issue
# hit "e" 
# hit "." 
# type "prio" & tab
# change the priority

Would be nice to get the shortcut back.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Shortcut to update priority missing on Rapid boards

fields.description: It would be useful to see the total of Story Points/Original Estimate for the Backlog as well. For now, it is only possible to see the total for the Sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the total of Story Points/Original Estimate on the Backlog

fields.description:
In Greenhopper 5, there was a link to Classic board via "More Actions -> Planning Board". Please see 
!Classic Board.PNG|thumbnail!

After upgrading to Greenhopper 6, the link was replaced to Rapid board. Please see
!Rapid Board.PNG|thumbnail!

Perhaps there is an improvement that can make this two links to be available in Greenhopper. 
* Either, the classic boards must show up in the "Agile -> View on board" as available boards or "More Actions -> Planning Board".
* A documentation of how to configure rapid boards to show exactly what the classic boards show.
fields.summary: View on board function not available for Classic Board Greenhopper

fields.description: Per user requirements, would be feasible if 'Plan' view can support also completed sprints whereby users cab have the ability to view sprints tasks list on that view in sake of usability purpose.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to view completed sprints tasks list in the plan view

fields.description:
The Epic Status custom field has three value 'To Do', 'In Progress' and 'Done'. While the meaning of first and last are obvious, the meaning of 'In Progress' is not defined anywhere. Also GreenHopper does not seem to change that field to 'In Progress' when the stories are being done.

We need to enhance the documentation about the purpose of that value.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Completing+an+Epic
fields.summary: Epic Documentation for 'In Progress' State

fields.description:
The GreenHopper [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Supported+Platforms] documentation currently lists some incorrect information for JIRA 5.2.x (and possibly others) - it has the below for JIRA 5.2.X:

{quote}
(/) Supported with GreenHopper 5.9.x and 5.10.x and 6.0.x and 6.1.x
{quote}

However testing JIRA 5.2.5 and GH 5.10.6 did not work. Looking at the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira] link for GreenHopper, it does have the correct version information for GreenHopper 5.10.6, and as confirmed with the devs we should go off this matrix rather than the Support Platforms docs.

Can you please modify those docs so that they advise users to check the marketplace? I was going to change it myself but wasn't sure how to make it look the best.

Thanks! :)
fields.summary: Update Supported Platforms Documentation

fields.description: We have had comments, and I have seen comments from others, that accidentally releasing a sprint is a common problem.  There is no way to undo this which makes this a particularly disruptive mistake.  It should be possible to un-release a sprint, or at the very least there should be a confirmation dialog warning the user that the action cannot be undone.

fields.description:
All builds take up to an hour. 

If they fail, somebody needs to try to fix them then wait an hour to see if they go green again. We check in on red builds because it's not practical to wait. 

It would be good to at least do the following:
1. separate the stages and have some kind of fast feedback (compile + unit tests at least)
2. figure out what is taking a long time and what we can do about it
fields.summary: Make the GH builds provide feedback more quickly

fields.description: Message tells about epic not being on board, but should say that epic can be accessed in the epic report
fields.summary: Marking an epic as done now has wrong message

fields.description:
As an GreenHopper OnDemand user, when viewing an issue in the Rapid Board planning mode, clicking on the project avatar does not display the project shortcuts pop up. This behaviour is not consistent with JIRA or Confluence when clicking on the project avatar when viewing a JIRA issue or Confluence page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+custom+links+to+help+users+navigate
fields.summary: Display project shortcuts in the project avatar when viewing an issue in the rapidboard

fields.description: When viewing a board in plan mode, you can click between the sprint and backlog to adjust what issues are in the sprint, but this looks like a simple UI tool to expand the sprint window.  This is very misleading and can result in bouncing issues out of the sprint.
fields.summary: Sprint 'scroll' bar at the bottom of the sprint looks like a UI tool, not an actionable button

fields.description: As of now, if Issues on a Board are to be sorted by Status, it'll be done based on Status IDs, and not their names. This means that users have little control over how the sorting is done, as Status IDs cannot be modified. It would be handy to be able to select a method by which the sorting is done.
fields.summary: Ability to sort issues on a Board by Status Name and not Status ID

fields.description:
In the rapid board using the "plan" view you can see all epics in a special column on the left side of the screen. For each epic you can expand the view to see more details, e.g. the number of stories linked to that epic.

This view is quite nice to get a quick overview of an epic but lots of things are missing, such as:

- list of clickable issue ids linked to the epic
- logged work per issue
- sum of logged work of all linked issues
fields.summary: A user should see more time statistics in the epic column

fields.description:
Currently functionality for move to sprint and creation of sprint are restricted to boards ordered by Rank.
This Suggestion is for the board (and Backlog) to be ordered by other criteria in the filter with this functionality.
fields.summary: Ability to work with Sprints when Backlog not ordered by Rank

fields.description:
As can be seen in the screenshot below, we can see that we have several markers to indicate the amount of *Story Points* for the current sprint and also the future sprint.

If we can have another marker that indicates the total amount of *Issues* and *Story Points* for the *Backlog* as well.
!backlog_marker.JPG!
fields.summary: Ability to have a statistic marker that displays the total amount of issues and Story Points in Backlog

fields.description: Currently a new Scrum project does not have any fix versions. It won't help new users to be able to start using GH with the new release planning.
fields.summary: Add some sample fix version data to the Sample Data for new Scrum projects

fields.description: In the new JIRA layout it doesn't look very clear why the checkbox for sample data is in between the two workflow options. I got confused when I first saw it about why the JIRA default workflow seemed stranded at the bottom.
fields.summary: Workflow radios and sample data checkbox look kind of confusing

fields.description:
* State persisted in URL
* Default view is Versions panel is collapsed
* When both versions and epics panels are collapsed, show affordances that allow the user to differentiate between the two

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if the detail view is not visible either?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As Patrick I'd like to be able to hide the versions panel
As a user I would like to see an issue's summary on the tooltip in burndown/epic chart

fields.description: It would be extremely useful to have the possibility to define multiple swim-lane configurations, say for example 1) Based on Assignee, 2) Based on JQL and the users of the boards can switch the swimlane view by the click of a button.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper Administrator Ability to Define Multiple Swimlane Configurations

fields.description:
This option:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Synchronising+Versions+and+Components+for+your+Issues

h5. The problem:
The version synchroniser field is ignored if GH's configuration

Affects GH 6.1.2

h5. Steps to Reproduce:
* Disable Version sync in GH's config
* Create new Project, let's use *DEMO*
* Add a version, let's use *v1*
* Create issue with *v1* set as the fixVersion
* Create sub-task from this issue
* Check sub-task, notice that fixVersion is defined as v1

h5. Workaround
* Ensure disable the project that you do not want versions to be copied
fields.summary: Verson Synchroniser option is ignored, always enabled

fields.description: According to this documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ranking+an+Issue#RankinganIssue-Tipsandnotes:, right-clicking an issue in plan mode should make a menu with a few actions to pop up, but only a default browser menu is shown, no matter which browser/OS.
fields.summary: Right-clicking an issue in plan mode does not work as described
Access quick filters via REST API
Access sprints from REST API

fields.description:
We need access to issues through the REST API. Either through something like /xboard/work/allData (includes done) or /xboard/plan/backlog/data 

Example:

GET /rest/greenhopper/1.0/api/board/1/issue?includeDone=true

{code}
[
    {
      "id": 10000,
      "key": "SSP-1",
      "hidden": false,
      "typeName": "Story",
      "typeId": "7",
      "summary": "As an Agile team, I'd like to learn about Scrum >> Click the \"SSP-1\" link at the left of this row to see detail in the Description tab on the right",
      "typeUrl": "http://localhost:2990/jira/images/icons/ico_story.png",
      "priorityUrl": "http://localhost:2990/jira/images/icons/priority_major.gif",
      "priorityName": "Major",
      "done": false,
      "color": "#66cc33",
      "estimateStatistic": {
        "statFieldId": "customfield_10002",
        "statFieldValue": {
          "value": 2,
          "text": "2"
        }
      },
      "statusId": "10000",
      "statusName": "To Do",
      "statusUrl": "http://localhost:2990/jira/images/icons/subtask.gif"
    },
]
{code}

It would be fine if this was part of a larger resource that also returns data about projects, sprints, markers, etc.
fields.summary: Access board issues from REST API
Access boards from REST API

fields.description:
ReportUrlState and RapidBoardState handle storing all the parameters in the URL with lots of ifs to determine the current state and write the params properly. 

It would be nicer to have some way for things to plug in the params that need to be written to the URL. 

For example when creating the new Epic Report a lot of this code had to be changed, also when changing the behaviour of the detail view, and in both cases it was the source of bugs. 

Lastly it would be nice to have more tests :)
fields.summary: Refactor UrlState code so that it's not all in one place (JS)
Refactor inheritance from AbstractLoggable to use LoggerFactory (Java)
Refactor all Analytics events to use the new AnalyticsTracker code (JS)
ADG GH: Work mode - Sprint filters

fields.description:
1. Make all Ajax calls use the promise instead of success and error
2. Make all Ajax calls use getSettings 
3. Once this is done, move getSettings into the Ajax method and remove calls in the methods
4. Finally refactor Ajax.js to remove _ensureDeferredCallbacks, and remove extra code for handling errors
fields.summary: Refactor GreenHopper Ajax calls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-7380].
  {panel}

After setting the flagging field to a non-empty value, the "days in column" on the card is set to 15736. This occurs when using a global loop transition to set this field via a "flagging" screen (doesn't matter if the transition takes place in the kanban view or the issue list/detail page).

Issue is self-resolved after changing the status of the card in question.

Steps to reproduce:
===============

- Create a workflow 
- Add a couple of steps
- Add a transition for one step with the same step as destination (loop transition) - doesn't need to do anything else for the purpose of reproducing the bug
- Assign a project to use the workflow
- Create a Kanban board for the workflow
- Create some issues and then use the loop transition on them
- Hover over the dots at the bottom of the issue in Work mode until the tooltip appears and it says 15000+ days (I didn't get quite the same value but it was definitely around that)

(alternatively, use the simple workflow (sw) project in the GreenHopper sample data)
fields.summary: Setting Flagging field with loop transition sets days in column to incorrect value
